[vc_row type=”full_width_background” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” bg_color=”#1b203e” bg_image=”6281″ bg_position=”center top” background_image_loading=”default” bg_repeat=”no-repeat” scene_position=”center” top_padding=”7%” bottom_padding=”10″ translate_y=”0″ text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overflow=”visible” id=”services” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” top_margin=”5%” bottom_margin=”5%” column_element_direction_desktop=”default” column_element_spacing=”default” desktop_text_alignment=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” background_color=”#ffffff” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_backdrop_filter=”none” column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” column_position=”default” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”2/3″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” animation_type=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”Black Allyship Program” font_container=”tag:h2|font_size:44|text_align:left|color:%23000000|line_height:50px” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1742222442211{margin-top: 30px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}” text_direction=”default”]

Thursday 16th October

10am – 1pm

[/vc_column_text][vc_video link=”https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=11fQoz8cYEY” css=””][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1754924480553{margin-top: 30px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}” text_direction=”default”]

The Black Allyship Programme offers a space for allies, diversity champions, and organisational leaders to come together and collaborate on how to build equitable workplace cultures that empower Black talent.

Through open-forum discussions and courageous conversations, attendees will learn how to recognise and challenge systemic inequities, support employee-led initiatives, and lead inclusive cultures where Black employees are supported to thrive.

Join this active community of change-makers who understand that true allyship requires continuous learning, brave leadership, and sustained action to create workplaces where everyone has the opportunity to succeed.

Key themes:
1. Leverage collective strength, through collaborative partnerships, to address systemic inequities and bring about lasting change
2. Discuss practical steps to create equitable organisations and increase support for Black professionals in the workplace
3. Learn cost-effective tools, skills, and strategies to embed inclusivity into every aspect of your organisation
4. Understand how to recognise and challenge actions, systems, and policies that undermine workplace belonging
5. Create inclusive environments where Black employees feel genuinely supported, valued, and empowered to reach their full potential

column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Aggie Mutuma

CEO & Lead Strategic Consulting Director, Mahogany Inclusion[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Aggie Yemurai Mutuma, the CEO of Mahogany Inclusion Partners, is a multi-award-winning Inclusion and Anti-Racism expert, Executive Coach, and captivating speaker. With over 25 years of experience in People strategy, Aggie excels at partnering with organisations to transform cultures, leadership and mindsets.

Her recent accolades include being voted as the UK’s 5th Most Influential HR Thinker in 2024 and top 20 in 2025. As a trusted advisor for the CIPD and an engaging speaker, Aggie has delivered powerful insights at prestigious events, including CBI conferences, FTSE 100 organisations, and numerous CIPD Annual Conferences. Her impact spans global FTSE 100 companies, third sector, public sector and central and local government.

Aggie engages executive leaders and their teams to deliver transformative Inclusive culture strategies. Her unique ability to create judgment-free spaces empowers leaders to align their actions with core values, catalysing meaningful cultural transformation.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” text_direction=”default”]

Habee Folami

Director of EDI, People & Culture, METRO Charity[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Habee Folami is the Director of EDI, People and Culture at METRO Charity, where she leads the organisation’s people strategy, HR function and culture transformation. As a consultant, she has supported over 50 organisations, including the British Red Cross, Sony Pictures Entertainment, and the LEGO Group. Habee is recognised for her combination of operational expertise, commercial acumen and compassionate leadership. Her advocacy for equity was significantly influenced by her involvement in sport, as a world champion powerlifter who challenged gender stereotypes in a male-dominated sport. Today, she empowers organisations to translate inclusive values into strategy, culture and measurable change. text_direction=”default”]

Rebecca Woodley

DEI Lead EMEA, Dentsu[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Rebecca Woodley is a global Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DEI) leader with extensive experience designing and delivering multi-region strategies across EMEA, MENA, APAC, and the US. Currently DEI Director at Dentsu EMEA, she partners with leadership teams and clients to embed inclusive practices into business processes, talent pipelines, and  organisational culture.

A BIMA 100 award winner and sought-after industry speaker, Rebecca has led transformative initiatives including EMEA-wide inclusion strategies, gender equity roadmaps, and the IGNITE Internship Programme, recognised for creating pathways for under-represented talent in the creative industries. Her work has delivered measurable impact improving representation in leadership roles, increasing retention, and developing AI-powered tools that provide data-driven insights for DEI progress.

text_direction=”default”]

Phil Baker

Director of Global Professional Services, WWT[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

A truly passionate and well-respected people leader, Phil currently manages the international professional services team at World Wide Technology (WWT).

Prior to joining WWT, Phil was a senior leader at Cisco managing a $285m services business driving IT & AI transformation across numerous blue chip brands. His drive to foster great teams and culture, helped Cisco to be the No.1 ‘Great Place to Work’ internationally.

Phil’s true passion is people, after all, that’s what really matters right? As a certified exec coach, he has actively helped numerous individuals throughout his career and runs master classes on driving High Performance teams & culture. With a strong passion for Inclusion & Diversity, Phil personally led an I&D movement for Cisco across Europe designed to evolve how we drive change and continues to be an active Ally.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” text_direction=”default”]

Luan Hughes

Chief Information Officer, Telent[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

A highly experienced Business and Technology Leader having worked for over 25 years’ directing global business transformations and IT operations across a variety of Industry sectors including FMCG, Consulting Services and Software Manufacturing.  Luan has spent a large portion of her career delivering large-scale IT Transformation projects, driving Technology Strategy and Digital Innovation, but also is passionate about people and organisational development and leveraging Technology as a true business enabler.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” text_direction=”default”]

David McQueen

Executive Coach & Co-Founder, Q Squared Ltd[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

David McQueen is passionate about helping leaders to communicate for personal and business growth. He is the husband of one, father of two, and friend of many. An executive coach, facilitator and international speaker, he has worked with corporates and non profits worldwide to develop their senior, middle and emerging leadership teams. His clients include Mercedes Benz, Sky, BMW, JP Morgan, Uber, Fidelity Investments, Societe General, EY Foundation, and Barnados. He is a 3x TEDx speaker and the author of The BRAVE Leader: Better Decisions for Inclusive Leadership.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” text_direction=”default”]

Luke Kennedy

Market Manager, Gateshead, IKEA[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Luke is the Market Manager for IKEA Gateshead, bringing over two decades of experience in retail and people leadership. Having started his journey as a part-time co-worker, Luke has grown through IKEA with the support of inclusive leadership and powerful allyship. Today, he is deeply committed to being part of meaningful change – championing equity, development, and belonging across the business. Luke believes allyship is not just a value, but a responsibility, and he actively works to create opportunities for others to grow, thrive, and lead.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” text_direction=”default”]

Edward Odofin

Founder, EMERGE & Global Business Resilience Lead, BBC[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Edward Odofin is a modern trailblazer and passionate advocate for diversity and inclusion across corporate workplaces. He currently serves as the Global Business Resilience Lead for the BBC and is also the external engagement lead for BBC Embrace, the BBC’s race diversity staff network.

Edward is also the founder of EMERGE: The ERG Community, a cross-industry coalition of staff network leads advocating for Black professionals in corporate spaces. The group champions collaboration, amplifies impact, and fosters connection across sectors and industries, by bringing together ERG leaders to ignite ideas, share bold practices, and build initiatives that uplift Black professionals at every level.

Edward has led impactful conversations on equity and leadership at prestigious platforms including the House of Lords, University of Cambridge, DTX, Cannes Lions, and more.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” text_direction=”default”]

Rehana Nanji

Global Head of D&I & Employee Engagement, M+C Saatchi Group [/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Rehana is passionate about People Engagement, Inclusion and Learning. She works globally and locally to ensure every employee has a voice and to develop a world class employment brand which is diverse and inclusive. With a career that spans recruitment, culture-building, and strategic engagement, she brings a uniquely human-centered approach to organisational transformation.

text_direction=”default”]

Natasha Taylor

Content Director, UK Black Business Week & Show[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Natasha is a seasoned event producer and project manager, having worked in the content development and events space for nearly ten years. Currently working as the Content Director for the UK Black Business Week & Show, she takes pride in delivering highly impactful, well researched, and dynamic events that educate and inspire. Over the years, she has delivered a number of bespoke conferences and large-scale exhibitions, including the award-winning DTX Manchester & Manchester Tech Week. She is a keen writer and in her spare time, you’ll often find her with a book in hand.
